item.title: Deep Learning in Engineering
item.description: Physics-Informed Deep Learning (PINN) is my main research focus now. I am trying to describe geo- and solid-mechanics relations in this framework both for data-driven modeling and discovery (inversion).

item.title: Constitutive Modeling
item.description: Modeling material behavior has been a major part of my studies to describe material response at macro-scale. It involves modeling isotropic and anisotropic materials, creep, and degradation.

item.title: Modeling of Fracturing and Localization
item.description:
Modeling fracture initiation and propagation has been a major active research area. In a set of studies, I have used XFEM and damage mechanics to describe fracture propagation.

I have then used the framework to model different fracture modes along with experimental validations.

My major PHD contribution is description of localization in XFEM framework. Additionally, I re-described the embedded discontinuity model to describe discrete cracking and localization. I have also extended the framework to account for material anisotropy. It also resulted to description of discontinuous Fourier law. An example can be seen here:

After validation of the model on trial axial experiments, we then use the framework to describe slope stability analysis:

item.title: Numerical Methods
item.description: Numerical solution techniques is a great interest of mine and will continue my research on these topics.
